https://www.thetimes.com/uk/article/lord.title: Lord Fraser of Corriegarth obituary
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/article/lord.subtitle: Former Conservative Party treasurer and Barings banker who famously confronted Extinction Rebellion in his dressing gown
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/article/lord.text: It was one of the defining pictures of the Extinction Rebellion protests in October 2019: Lord Fraser of Corriegarth, a Tory donor and former party treasurer, emerging from his home in the heart of Westminster clad in nothing more than a white dressing gown and monogrammed slippers to confront a colourful band of noisy protesters whose carnival had turned from Smith Square into Lord North Street.\nJack Hill, the Times photographer who caught the occasion, recalled: “It is a beautiful street and I ran ahead to capture the contradiction of the protest band and the genteel surroundings. I noticed a man at his front door in his dressing gown and slippers. He saw the band and started waving his fist angrily at them. Was he
image: Fraser would have kept his low profile were it not for the Lord North Street set-to
